page.title: 14Birdbrook.Church.Post House.
page.content: The name of the village is derived from the brook which passes through it.It does not seem to have any relation to birds, but there are many attractive bird plaques on the cottages.The{church}was built in 11th century,using stone flint and pebble rubble mixed with tiles gleaned from a {Roman villa.}For the last 12 years there has been a{Flower Festival}in the church. It is held in June.This year the theme is The Life Of Moses.The church is decorated with flowers to tell the story. The money collected is going to The Save the Children Fund and to the Restoration Fund.{The Old Post House}dates back to 1840 when it was an ale house called THE WHITE HORSE.Then it was a bakery and it was used as a post office until 1967.
